intro: Resia bracteata, commonly known as the Natal bracteate, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Resia bracteata typically grows in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forested areas.
